intro: Anaphalis maxima, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Anaphalis maxima is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers.
